text: Just discovered that pages in staging don't get set to zero for analytics when moved out of staging to prime time...

Example: new homepage page just launched. Has data from 12 days ago of multiple people reviewing and looking at page.

Published from staging and the analytics followed the page. My assumption would be that it would start at 0 once published soas not to skew the data

1.
Warning:Blog Content - Blog post template
Unable to find property slug on line 21
2.
Warning:Blog Content - Blog post template
Unable to find property name on line 21
3.
Warning:Blog Content - Blog listing template
Unable to find property post_list_summary_featured_image on line 51
its mainly with the topic tag
<p>By {{content.blog_author.display_name}} | {{ content.publish_date_localized }}{% for topic in content.topic_list %} | <a class="topic-link" href="{{ group.absolute_url }}/topic/{{ topic.slug }}">{{ topic.name }}</a>{% endfor %}</p>
has anyone else seen those warnings lately in their blog templates?
This was such a pain when we first used staging. They really need a "reset stats" button.
You can safely ignore those warnings, we are working on removing them
Thanks!
Does anyone knows if is possible to add a HubSpot navigation snippet to wordpress?
for example, add the same navigation on wordpress like the one that is on HubSpot and when I change the data into the HS navigation panel to auto update on wordpress as well?
you could theoretically do it if the navigation were done through HubDB instead of advanced menus. I don’t think you can do it without maybe using an API if you’re using advanced menus
and with HubDb is going to work? how am I going to get hubl code to loop through ?
with HubDB you’d use the javascript API and loop through the rows to generate the same thing you would using HubL
oh ! I didn't knew that HubDB has a JS API as well
you could even possibly do the api call serverside, but I’m not a good person to ask about that.
cool, thanks for the advice :slightly_smiling_face: I will have a better look myself and see what I can find
is there a way to pull items from the products library into page content or even forms?
or is it just for deals pipeline stuff?

HubSpot Products are meant to just be used for deals/quotes.
Depending on the use case though, you might be able to use the Products API to update a contact property, or a HubDB table or something <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/products/products-overview>
Are you able to use .json?
only seeing ability to create a .js file
you cannot create a true .json file no.  That doesn’t mean you can’t use a js file or even  a .html file as if it’s a json file
trying to point from one .js file to another local .js file... seems to get blocked no matter how it is called, any idea why?

~Ok question on updating a pages featured image when a social post was already scheduled. Will that image update? As of right now, the featured image seems to still be the old one so I was just checking~ looks like it does
or just wipe it when hte publish button happens.
ulgh.
Agreed. Even if they had an update API that would allow for resetting the stats. That why you could avoid any accidental update from the portal dashboard by users.
